fullProgramDescription: The Department of English offers a program of study leading to a Bachelor of Arts degree in English. The undergraduate major is designed to give students a broad understanding of English literature, including the historical development of the language, literary genres, and major authors. Students develop skills in close reading, critical thinking, and written and oral communication.
shortProgramDescription: The English major at Stanford provides a comprehensive education in English literature, preparing students for diverse careers or further study.

learningOutcomes: Demonstrate a broad knowledge of English literature across historical periods and genres.
Analyze literary texts critically and thoughtfully.
Develop effective written and oral communication skills.
Understand various theoretical and contextual approaches to literary study.
Apply close reading skills to interpret literary texts.
Produce well-researched and well-argued written work.
creditRequirements: 45 English department units; total approx. 180 quarter units
additionalInformation: Students declare through the School of Humanities and Sciences. Course choices should be made in consultation with an adviser to ensure breadth and depth in the major.
